Reviews.Title: “Out of the ordinary ,out of the hassle”
Reviews.Author: bulu21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a the Club several times and return for many reasons, not least of all because its a bit eclectic and the rooms are unusual shapes and design, all decked out in Black and White as is the entire hotel. Its in Chinatown in an area of old buildings and boutique restaurants. You don't want to stay here if your here for a few days shopping only. Its a small hotel and does not have a lot of common areas or big hotel amenities, but I return because its different and not the normal hotel room. The only thing they cant together is hot water, the shower is inevitably just a tad off of bring totally cold. However having stayed in many different hotels in Singapore I return !

Reviews.Title: “Do not be deceive!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Frequfly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel in March 2012. We were deceived by its advertisement and photo that descript the hotel as 'boutique' and 4 stars. The truth is it is only a BUDGET hotel but it charged at a 4 start price. We paid 200USD for this hotel that in reality you can get a 50USD similar class like hotel 81 nearby. It has no swiming pool, less than 50 rooms and worse of all, at its top floor (3rd floor) it ha a night bar which barred all the way pass mid night. You can't get a good sleep and it is noisy. It has all the 'Western' names , like Harris etc but in reality, it is owned by Indian company. The so calll 'Viet/France' restuarant charge exorbitant price and it service is terrible bad. It setting at the roof with a few cloths decoration and it owner is so arrogant that it spoil your entire meal. It better to eat at nearby hawker center that worth every cents. It is unbelievable that Singapore tourist promotion board allow such pratice by forigner hotel operator in Singapore....

Reviews.Title: “Okay for short stays”
Reviews.Author: GinJose
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four days at The Club. It has a good location in the Chinatown area of Singapore and is close to a lot of clubs and restaurants. The room was large enough and clean, and the room had a great bathroom. I did notice that previous reviewers had complained about carpet stains, but I don't think that any hotel can avoid some minor carpet stains, which was all I found and they were no worse than those I noted in any 5-star hotel. Unlike some reviewers I found the staff, including those on the front desk to be very friendly and helpful and they did offer to assist with my luggage. This hotel did have two drawbacks in my view. First, there were no drawers or shelves for clothes and I hate living out of a suitcase. Second there was no comfortable place to just sit and read. The one easy chair in the room was not comforttable and there is no lobby. Given that, I would not recommend this hotel for anything other than a short-term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really very poor - goodness know how it's won any awards....”
Reviews.Author: quirky76
Reviews.Content: I'm a real fan of boutique hotels and always valued any one that wins a trip advisor award but this place is just really terrible. I arranged an early checkin and they'd forgot and had nothing for me, so I agreed to go and get some breakfast and come back in an hour once they made a room up. They didn't bother and a girl under 20 who was on reception said theyd run out of sheets and no manager or adult was on duty until 10 ish - she tried her best but please ! When I got into my room, there was dirty bed linen all alomg the hall way and the room was tired, dirty walls, ripped and stained carpets - they'd obviously tried to touch up the walls with white paint and then forgot to do it mid way though and given up. The furniture is stained and paint was flaking and dirty The cafe is like an old beach cafe in Greece and run down - the roof bar is very nice but often rented out to corporate entertaining so not available Guys in trip advisor the fact this place is baring an award from you is poor and damaging to your reputation .....,

Reviews.Title: “Tired and not run by adults”
Reviews.Author: MeetmeinSaintLouis
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks great in pictures but is tired and need of some TLC. Phones in rooms do not work, there are no amenities like hair dryers and electric conversion plugs, wash cloths etc. in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Under par”
Reviews.Author: thechilibuddy
Reviews.Content: I thought that as a Tripadvisor selected hotel, that The Club would be remarkable in at least some way. I was disappointed. It has so much "could be" possibility but just doesn't try hard enough to make itself stand out especially right next to The Scarlett. Weaknessess - two days in a row, the rooms were not made when I returned around 5pm. This isn't a backpackers, I've put the sign out to make the room so why does it take so long? It's not like this place has hundred's of rooms! - For some reason, they took away the shower cap I was using but didn't replace it with a new one. I didn't need a new one since I much prefer to be green, but if you're going to take it away replace it? Instead, they gave us new toothbrushes (but didn't take the old ones away?) Doesn't make any sense. - I think they should provide more water. 2 little bottles for hot and sweltering Singapore? - There were tape marks or the sticky residue of tapes on the cupboards which gave it a sort of tired and lazy vibe of the staff. - The least the staff could do was at least greet the guests with a smile and a hullo/good morning if the rest of the hotel was sub par. Unfortunately, I will not be coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: QUELLE_10
Reviews.Content: As a matter of fact: we spent 30 mins at the hotel and after the hotel management showed us a second room that was also worn down and shabby we decided to leave. It's supposed to be a new, stylish and hip boutique hotel, but has nothing but worn down interior: many ugly dots of spilled water, juice, whatever on the carpet, very dirty curtains we didn’t dare to touch (look like wine spills) and many worn down elements of the white furniture. Further different hair leftovers on the bed and in the bathroom. We usually have no problem staying at such al location if we are speaking of a youth hostel or backpacker, but not if you want to be a stylish, hip and trendy boutique hotel! We moved on to the Scarlet hotel right around the corner, perfect to stay, highly to recommend.. btw: feedback of the management on the above mentioned circumstances: "It's not easy to keep an interior design in white and black all niche and shiny all the time.." and this after a bit more as a year after opening??

Reviews.Title: “Interesting design but price is not justified!”
Reviews.Author: mathelaci
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights mainly because my wife like the look of this hotel! I am not that keen on boutique hotels and this hotel confirmed my opinion. The design its interesting, but the whole place looks a little bit tired. Staff was nice and helpful, they have upgraded our room because there was some sort of confusion with the reservation. The rooftop bar is a nice place to hang out, even though when we were there we were the only customers. Good location, very close to 2 food courts. Would I go back? No.

Reviews.Title: “Love the design, had some problems with hot water”
Reviews.Author: MJMJMJ
Reviews.Content: We love the designs in this room. We had some fun looking for all the hidden power points and appliances which were all so cleverly folded or hidden away under and around, which was part of the room design. The room we had was surprisingly spacious and we love the fact that you only walk 3 minutes to Maxwell Food Court which had at least a hundred different stalls selling all sorts of delicious local foods at bargain prices! My only little gripe was, our room had some problems with hot water. After turning the shower on for 5 minutes and turning the heat onto maximum, the water was at most, a lukewarm. I love me warm showers too much to overlook this. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with no hot water!”
Reviews.Author: pam2424
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant overnight stay here in March 2011 and decided to overnight again on our way home recently. Big mistake - what is going on in this place? When we checked in the receptionist could not work out how to swipe our credit card. The room and bathroom were very nice. We thought we would have a coffee in the room and called reception for some fresh milk and another cup (the room only had one). Eventually someone arrived with a fistful of coffeemate artificial whitener sachets, and no cup. On the second attempt we received 2 cups but no milk. What sort of hotel can't provide a jug of fresh milk? We had hot showers, found that there was no hair dryer and waited a while for one to be delivered. It's a great location for eating out and when we got back we decided to use our vouchers for compimentary cocktails in the rooftop bar. Could I have a glass of wine (at half the price) instead of a cocktail? No, as I was sternly told, the vouchers were not transferable. We had an early start the next morning and asked reception to book a taxi for 6.45am. We later confirmed with them that they knew it was am and not pm. Up early next morning, after a broken night's sleep with all the noise from the bar and its patrons, to find that the water was cold. I told the receptionist this and she just went on tapping at her computer. Furious, I asked her again why the shower water was cold. All she said was "we apologise for the inconvenience" and went on typing. There was no explanation and no concern about the impact on us and other guests. A man checking out at the same time confirmed that he had no hot water either. Perhaps they are saving money by not turning the water heaters on early? There was no sign of our taxi, and the receptionist had no record of a booking. One of the other receptionists got up from having a cigarette whilst sitting in the gutter at the front door, and went inside to check. A taxi eventually arrived and we vowed never to return to this hotel. It seems to be staffed by total amateurs. No longer recommended, unless you like to pay a high price for bad service, poor sleep and cold showers.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed, could be fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: LondonBlueJ
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel on recommendation as we wanted to stay in a boutique hotel rather than one of the big multinational group hotels. The hotel has a lot going for it, as it is in a great location and it is a great Colonial style building The rooms are very trendy, but just about everything that could be wrong with the hotel showed itself to us during the 3 nights we there. We arrived late in the evening, very unhelpful on reception, like we were disturbing them. Nobody to help us with bags either into the hotel or in the very small elevator up to our room on 2nd floor. 1 of the girls on reception did help, after telling me that they had no porter or anyone to help with cases. The room was a Signature room and looked great, but used bottles of soap & shampoo in the shower, the most discusting unclean mini bar refrigerator, stains on the carpets and stains on the cabinet that makes up the head of the bed takes the shine of the room design. I took photo's of the fridge, but I won't put those on to the review. Next day, we left and got back to the hotel around 3.30pm. The room had not been made up, so we called and requested it be done. We then left and told reception that we were leaving so please attend to the room. We got back at 5.30 and the guy was still trying to get it done, so obviously even though we received apologies at the time, it was not enough to get it done without delay and minimise the inconvenience to us. When we checked out, I went to reception to ask about transit to the airport to order a cab and confirm the time needed. Having told them we would be ready in 20 minutes, again no offer of help with baggage, no preparation of the invoice and a call when we got to reception to get a cab. The room was a great design, the building is great and the location fantastic, as I already said, but the staff and the way the hotel is allowed to operate really let it down very badly...

Reviews.Title: “It's something special”
Reviews.Author: TTDao
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night there on my way back home, I wish I could stay longer. Ann Siang Road is a small sympathic quiet corner in the crowdy Chinatown and The Club is a small pretty black and white hotel just in the middle of this corner. It's small but it has everything you may like to enjoy. A cafe, a restaurant, a basement bar and a rooftop bar. My room was large, bathroom as well, and very clean. I specially like the modern design of the bathroom and the layout of the bedroom. Management and staffs were friendly, they speak good English, which is a particularity of Ann Siang Road. There were some shortcoming : a telephone which didn't work, an aromatic candle with no match, but overall I like their care when listening to your complain, I like the way they apologize, I like to sit on their windy rooftop bar and I mostly like having a cold drink at their terrace cafe which reminds me any terrace cafe of Colline Montmartre. I'll be back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “hmmm...not too sure.”
Reviews.Author: soapopera
Reviews.Content: ....welcome by a staff which run away when he saw me with my suitcases and understood that I needed help. Not talking of the late lady duty receptionist which was lacking of friendliness. Room is ok. After all. We are in Singapore and it is indeed difficult to find great Boutique Hotel. I found it quite amateur....could do far more better. Location is great and the Hotel Manager. Craig I think , was truly a gem and doing an excellent job!.....he is aware of the weakness and believe that he is working on it. HK Manager was also excellent to talk to....therefore the cleaner was so-so. Would give them a second try!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless and unique, cosy hotel in the best part of Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: indipendente
Reviews.Content: This is a charming boutique hotel. It's theme is "black and white" and everything is... Rooms are fairly spacious, comfortable, with a large bathroom and good amenities. Free wifi is fast and reliable. It is just next to the great Maxwell food court, where you can eat great Chinese, Indian and other food for very reasonable prices. Lots of other restaurants around. It is also just a few minutes away from major temples. MRT is not far away. A good address in Singapore. Only problem I had was the aircon: the fan aimed right onto my bed, so it was a bit uncomfortably cold to go to sleep with a cold breeze right in your face! So I kept the A/C on all day and turned it off just before going to bed, but sometimes it got too hot in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Fussy01
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to staying in this place after arriving in Singapore on a very hot day. The hotel is in an excellent area and it was really easy to wander around. The hotel itself is felt a bit shabby. The Airconditioning was not in use on the floors outside the rooms which made the place feel really uncomfortable. Our room was a good size but a bit scruffy. Stains on the carpet around the bathroom door and 'cut out' sections of the carpet where stains were not able to be successfully removed.

Reviews.Title: “An okay Boutique...”
Reviews.Author: Skanji
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights and was given the room 210 which is right on the corner. Rooms are decent and have a TV and decent sized bathroom. Bed was comfortable. The windows look out onto the street so you can watch the world go by but also you get to hear all the noise and conversations going on outside when your're trying to sleep. Breakfast in the cafe is basic. Toast, orange and coffee. I asked them to have some boiled eggs for me as a special request and they were nice enough to sort it out as well as wheat toast instead of white. Free Wifi is a great plus. 10 minutes walk to Raffles Quay and 30 seconds to bars and restaurants. Not bad overall. Downsides, noise from outside and no pool or gym areas. Staff on the reception desk were clueless. One needed google maps to show me where the hotel was on my map. No late check out options as well (half day charge).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay with a word of caution”
Reviews.Author: VishnuB
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel to stay in for anyone who has work in Chinatown or a nearby business establishment. It's technology savvy with contactless keys, mood lighting, cordless room phone and a i-pod docking station. My first impression was that its a neat and suauve hotel with a well sone interior. The attached "La Chocolat" cafe is great for breakfast and savouries. Nights cannot be dull here as it is adjacent to Club Street where there are clubs and bistros for one to socialize and sip to glory. The hotel is walking distance from Chinatown MRT station and you'll find everything that you need closeby. The hotel calls for cabs whenever required and its pretty quick. On the flipside, i had "Peppermint Tea" from the stuff kept in my room as soon as i checked in. I had tea without milk and sugar, but it caused me severe food poisoning and i had to seek medical attention. Also, i ordered breakfast in my room twice, but nothing turned up. So, if you want breakfast served in your room, this is not the place for you. The front desk was kind and helpful and my overall impression is "Satisfied"

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xksb
Reviews.Content: I really like this boutique hotel in a very unique building (heard it was previously an office building). And prefer the antique-y feel of the structure as opposed to the posh high rises. The exterior of the building is pristine white and the hotel is situated in a popular shopping district. The rooms are clean (except for a few stains on the carpet). All the staff I see where very helpful and though it's a boutique hotel, you will find a full set of toiletries, complimentary water, kettle and tea facilities available to you. My only complaints are that both the elevators and internet are super slow.

Reviews.Title: “Cool rooms and great roof terrace bar”
Reviews.Author: sandcastle99
Reviews.Content: We booked this place based on Tripadvisor reviews and made a point of requesting a quiet room. First room we stayed in for a couple of nights had twin beds. Very comfortable beds but a bit narrow - especially for my husband. We then moved to a double room when one became available which was much better. Funky rooms - love the white. Light and airy and really nice bathrooms and amenities. Downside is that absolutely nowhere to put your clothes except for one hanging rack! Rather annoying as you would expect something like a shelf or some drawers... But free WiFi and lovely lighting. Nice pillows too. However, no hotel info in the rooms and if we hadn't previously looked at the hotel's website we wouldn't have even known there was a roof terrace! Caroline, the bar manager was wonderful and very helpful and made up for the rather uninformative front desk staff. Also no breakfast. But a great location. Roof top bar very noisy on Friday and Saturday nights so be careful which room you book if you want an early night.

Reviews.Title: “good location in the up market area of Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: rustycycle
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at the club and we found that it had gone downhill considerably since our last visit 6 mths ago. As previously reported everything is either black or white. Thats OK when its new, but it does take extra work to keep it looking that way. That hasn't happened at the club and its starting to become rundown. eg the carpet in our room was stained and also had large patches in it, not a good look. The breakfast has also gone downhill and is now not worth having, go elsewhere. There are no cupboards to put clothes etc in nor is there any other furniture other than a bed and one chair. No room service is another thing lacking. The only positive is its excellent location in Chinatown halfway between 2 MRT stations. It is overpriced for waht you get. Better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, good location, rooms try to be too trendy for my taste”
Reviews.Author: goodge79
Reviews.Content: location on a hill in chinatown with several bars and restaurants around was good, check in / check out was speedy, rooms are a bit pretentious, decent size, a bit noisy at night, price was good (late booking)

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfy design hotel with limited service”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Yanhui
Reviews.Content: Well located next to China town, in a quiet though lively neighborhood, nicely designed though small rooms. Service is as cool and minimalistic as the overall design, and breakfast is poor (stay out). Nevertheless recommendable alternative for a stay in Singapore, I will consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, clean rooms in Singapore's creative district”
Reviews.Author: powergrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Club for one night in December and its a great little design hotel. The bathrooms are probably the best feature of the rooms, its fully tiled in black and white. Very Alice in Wonderland. There is no room service, and strangely no information packs in the rooms, so you wouldn't really know what else the hotel has to offer. I can tell you that they have a great rooftop bar called Ying Yang, lovely views and a perfect place to unwind after a long day of sight seeing/shopping. The Scarlett hotel is right next to it, which I've stayed at too. Comparatively speaking, I definitely prefer The Club as the rooms are brighter and more airy. The Scarlett was a little stuffy. All in all, if you're looking for a nice, hip place to stay with decent rooms while in Singapore, The Club is a great choice and value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “and yet another boutique hotel !”
Reviews.Author: matgray
Reviews.Content: Another one but maybe one of the best. The staff were really great especially Michael who went out of his way to be helpful in many ways. The room was pleasant but a little on the small side, but this seems to be the way to go nowadays. A bit noisy on Friday and Saturday nights as it's location is close to some bars and clubs. The restaurant has a good and varied menu and drinks were just as expensive as the rest of Singapore After comparing the costs of 4 glasses of champagne at the hotel .. $72 against the same sparkling wine in Cairns at $28 a BOTTLE ...4 or 5 glasses. But , at the end of the day the verdict overall was thumbs up !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: SCandCS
Reviews.Content: Greeted by two friendly staff on December 31, 2010 at 1410hrs. Didn't get their name though. Helped me with my request and very prompted though the room I supposed to have wasn't available... Big big place... Room 304 is superb! Worth every penny... Got good deal from Booking.com.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfy rooms, uncertain staff”
Reviews.Author: Ipotravel
Reviews.Content: Booked the club hotel for one night. Before this I had called the hotel to confirm my booking, it must have taken 40 over rings in totally before the reception finally picked up the phone. For service sake, I'd advise this hotel to pick up at 3 rings Anyway upon arriving at the reception, realized that it is really teeny weenie. Was checked in in 10 min as there was only one staff at the counter. Got issued the key but nothing was explained to us about the room. Plus point would be the safety procedures undertaken as guest can only go up by scanning their room keys. The room doors were nicely designed with spin wheels. Lovely touch. And when we entered the room, it was big and cosy. Loved the carpet and floor bed. Negative-there were no informative brochure about the hotel, no pricelist for the mini bar. Totally uninformative! We even had trouble figuring out the knobs on the showers.. I had a cold shower the next morning as te heater was not working. Okay So those are the negative. This hotel is not that bad. Excellent location plenty of bars and cafe around. The heart of Chinatown is just behind. The clean white exterior of the hotel depicts chic and trendy. The price that I paid for was worth it. So what if they got negative points. You can't always have the best of both worlds. My advice to the management, pls provide your guest more info about your hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “It'd be nicer, if only they let me in..............”
Reviews.Author: poccoBangkok
Reviews.Content: Well, I am a designer based in Bangkok, but have projects in China and Singapore as well. Every time I have a chance to visit my projects, I prefer to stay at smaller Boutique Hotels instead of Big Brand name ones. Those of my favorites include The New Majestic Hotel in Singapore, JIA Hotel, Shanghai, and The China Club, Beijing. Lately, I heard of the new hotel in Singapore, called The Club by Harry's Hospitality, so I checked it out. The hotel is pretty chic and nice. I tried it once, not bad, actually. But not this time....... This week, I have another meeting in Singapore, so I booked the Signature Room (their bigger ones) for one night at 235 SG$++. Good deal. Chic and Big room for only 235 SG$!!! I was pretty excited. I arrived Singapore at 1pm, then I went to my project to supervise the Construction first. After a long tired day, I'd like to check in at the Club. When I arrived, the Reception asked for my passport. Then she asked me how many night I'd stay this time. One night, I told her. Things seemed pretty usual up to this point, then she apologized to me, saying that there'd be no room for me tonight. What the..... Her excuse was that 4 couples of their guests got Food Poisoning. So they had to extend their stays (that means 4 rooms'd not be available). I was thinking "Yeah, right. 8 Adults got Food Poisoning at the same time in the Clean-as-Hell Singapore?????", but didn't say it out loud. Moody I was, so the reception asked the Assistant Manager to come out. The Assistant Manager is an energetic guy. First he bragged that he already book the next door hotel, Scarlet Hotel, for me. Even better, he got me a great deal, an Executive Room with only 215 SG&! Sounds great, right? An Executive Room with only 215 SG&! Well, it wasn't that great after I carried all my bags to the next door, and found out later than an Executive Room is the smallest room (or the second smallest), and 215SG$ is their normal Rate, not special. I could book it myself. The Food Poisoning is not my problem. I am not even sure whether it is real or they just had an overbooking situation and needed some excuse to kick me out. Why I gotta find another hotel, and why I gotta stay at the smaller room???? At almost the same price??? This is ridiculous. Well, finally to the owner of the Club, I do love your Hotel Design. But if you think you could survive with the Design alone, I wish you a good luck........

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - if you like to go to sleep at night, don't bother staying here.”
Reviews.Author: MrsandMrsC
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to be staying at this new hotel...but from start to finish it was disappointing. The card machine would not let us use our cards (we had 4 different ones between us) to pay, so we had to ring back home to get a family member to use theirs instead?!?! Not sure what happened there. The room was on the 3rd floor, it seemed lovely, very trendy, big, etc. Except the 'Club' right above our room didn't stop pumping out music until 3am. We could hear it all, from screams of laughter to high heels stomping across the floor. AWFUL. We were not warned about this before hand, so weren't very happy that we'd paid for a Signature room when a basic on the first floor would have been better. The next night was even worse, the music didn't stop till 4am - there was cigarette smoke coming through the air vents, more noise and was unbearable. We phoned reception who sent a staff member up with cotton wool balls as they didn't have any ear plugs, and pulled all the curtains around the room to try and muffle the room. It didn't help and I felt sorry for the staff member who was embarrassed and said 'I'm sorry there's nothing we can do'. They knew it was our honeymoon, but that aside, you're paying top dollar to stay somewhere and you expect to get a good nights kip - but that is not the case here. We also noticed some 'stains' on the actual bedstead. GROSS!!! We told the staff and they changed the sheets???????? We gave up complaining and spent as much time as we could out of the hotel. Very disapointed. Wish we'd stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “groovy small hotel in the best part of town”
Reviews.Author: rossco234
Reviews.Content: The Club in Singapore is a small hotel in what must be one of the best areas of Singapore, close to Chinatown and all the night noodle markets, but also right on top of all the best tapas, French, winebars etc that Singapore has to offer. The Hotel has it's own groovy rooftop bar and a spanish/tapas bar as well. The rooms are designer chic, low slung beds, stark white walls and a striking black and white bathroom. The aircon was spot on,cooling the room down within seconds, something you need in Singapore's humid climate and the front desk staff attentive and keen to help out when they can. Only drawback would be the

Reviews.Title: “White-out”
Reviews.Author: madhot
Reviews.Content: Firstly, my eyes are still adjusting back to reality. This place is white. All of it. Which means the cracks/dirt/stuff i dont wanna think about is very visible. I liked: the rooms, the decor, the rain shower, the fact that Maxwell food centre is literally 2 minutes away. I didnt like: that the tv didnt work (apparently, it isnt the hotels's problem.. it's the cable provider.. and they shrugged their shoulders. In my opinion, if all your rooms are having TV connectivity problems.. Shouldnt you at least try to rectify the issue?) I also didn't see any other guests besides myself and my partner! (Or maybe that's cause we hardly left the room?) So if you like exclusivity/spookiness, this one's for you! On the whole, i enjoyed my stay cause the staff were cheery and happy ( to see us?), the room was gooorgeous, and I had good food 5 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay if only with friendly & welcoming front office”
Reviews.Author: tracomsg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Club hotel for 2 nights on 10 September.It is very new hotel with black and white concept.We stayed in Signature room.The bed is comfortable and the room is big with lovely shower.They have lovely roof top bar,suitable for chilled out . The drink price is reasonable ,the bar staff is friendly.The hotel is closed to bar and restaurant and walking distance to chinatown. The only disappointment is the front desk officer.The front desk is small and near to the main entrance which give no allowance for movement especially when come to busy check in /check out. The front desk officer and management need to be friendly and welcoming.And they need to be more helpful in assist customer with luggage. I believe the hotel will be lovely place to stay if only the staff and management are friendly and welcoming .

HotelInfo.Name: The Club by Harry's Hospitality
HotelInfo.Address: 28 Ann Siang Road, Singapore 069708, Singapore
